revised_title: Report of the Kew Committee: Observations and Experiments in Magnetism, Meteorology, and Solar Studies
tldr: The Kew Committee reports on various scientific observations and experiments conducted at Kew Observatory in 1891, including magnetic observations, meteorological observations, solar observations, and experimental work on wind instruments. The report covers findings on magnetic elements, atmospheric pressure, temperature, humidity, wind, sunshine, and atmospheric electricity, as well as details on the instruments used and their maintenance.
